image.altText: A train sitting at a train platform with people preparing to board.

props.synopsis: The ACT and NSW governments announce they'll work together on improving the railway line between Canberra and Sydney, but this is not a new subject for either.

title.children: Railway between Canberra and Sydney has long been an issue, and it's among Labor's pre-election promises

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: It can now be revealed that the former student teacher found guilty of sexual offences against a 15-year-old Canberra boy is 28-year-old Petra Shasha, who met the boy during a teaching placement at Canberra's St Edmund's College.

title.children: Teacher found guilty of sexual offences against teenage boy named after suppression order lifted

image.altText: Officer Cadets on parade at ADFA.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for 24-year-old Jake Sullivan are preparing to appeal after he was found guilty of three charges, including rape, last week.

title.children: Former defence cadet found guilty of rape freed on bail by ACT court

image.altText: A fire truck and a fire fighter using a hose to put out a fire.

props.synopsis: The ACT State Emergency Service is urging Canberrans to prepare for fires, floods and storms as the severe weather season begins.

title.children: 'Prepare yourself and your property': Bushfire season begins in ACT

image.altText: The exterior of a modern-looking school building

props.synopsis: A former Canberra Marist College student is preparing to sue over the canings and other corporal punishments he allegedly received as a young student in the early 1970s.

title.children: Former Marist College student preparing to sue over alleged historic corporal punishment, sexual abuse

image.altText: A woman with an umbrella walks in the University of Sydney quadrangle.

props.synopsis: Anti-Semitism is a "sad indictment" on the Australian university sector, a Senate inquiry has found, but holding a royal commission-like investigation into the issue would be "too slow".

title.children: University responses to anti-Semitism 'woefully inadequate', but Labor-led committee rejects judicial inquiry

image.altText: A woman sits smiling in a medical office.

props.synopsis: Many Australians have never used an Urgent Care Clinic as an alternative to an emergency department, but more are on the way and some medical professionals are not happy.

title.children: They were designed to reduce pressure on emergency departments. Are Urgent Care Clinics working?

image.altText: Clare Polkinghorne applauds Matildas fans

props.synopsis: Clare Polkinghorne will call time on a career spanning almost two decades when she takes the field against Brazil in December, and says she is leaving "the best job in the world".

title.children: 'Difficult to say goodbye': Matildas great Clare Polkinghorne announces retirement after record-breaking career

image.altText: close up of Efraim Halevy, the former head of the Israeli secret service Mossad

props.synopsis: Iran's attack on Israel took the former director of Mossad by surprise. But he urged Israel's PM Benjamin Netanyahu to consider his next steps carefully.

title.children: Former Mossad director warns 'all-out war with Iran' would be challenging

image.altText: An ambulance team loads a stretcher into the van

props.synopsis: Gunmen have killed at least six people in Tel Aviv, and Iran says it has launched some 200 missiles at Israel.

title.children: At least six killed in suspected Tel Aviv terror attack as Iran reports firing 200 missiles at Israel

image.altText: Jenny Moncur sits at a table and looks at her mobile phone

props.synopsis: Consumers and industry stakeholders are calling for better regulation of phone companies after family members of deceased customers are repeatedly contacted – in some cases for years after a person's death.

title.children: 'Telstra has got away with it': Widow's 'unforgivable' ordeal over her dead husband's account

image.altText: a woman smiling on a beach

props.synopsis: A new study investigating the link between sleep and pain could fundamentally change the way doctors and clinicians treat people with chronic pain.

title.children: New sleep study could be 'game-changer' for millions of Australians suffering from chronic pain

image.altText: Side view of boat ashore on city beach.

props.synopsis: An unoccupied boat washing ashore off a suburban beach near Hobart triggers an air and sea search.

title.children: Unoccupied boat washed ashore on beach near Hobart triggers air and sea search

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: After Qantas successfully lobbied against extra Qatar Airways flights, the Middle Eastern airline has exacted revenge on the Flying Kangaroo with a deal that will increase competition and possibly result in cheaper fares.

title.children: Qatar's Virgin hook-up a blow to Qantas

image.altText: Jahrome Hughes and Olivia Kernick with their NRL and NRLW Dally M Medals.

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm halfback Jahrome Hughes beats James Tedesco to the NRL Dally M Medal by one vote, while Roosters back rower Olivia Kernick is named the NRLW's best player.

title.children: Jahrome Hughes's thrilling Dally M win capped by impromptu haka from teammates

image.altText: Tiana Penitani wears a rose pink strapless dress

props.synopsis: The NRL and NRLW's finest are out tonight for the Dally M awards at Royal Randwick Racecourse. See the fashion on the red carpet as the stars arrive.

title.children: Sports stars hit the red carpet at Dally M Awards at Royal Randwick Racecourse

image.altText: Kamindu Mendis raises his bat and helmet after a century

props.synopsis: After a decade in purgatory, Sri Lanka is once again rising up as a men's cricket powerhouse. Its revival is centred around Kamindu Mendis, an ambidextrous bowler who is now doing things not seen in generations with the bat.

title.children: One of cricket's slumbering giants is waking again, and this star's Bradman-style numbers are behind it

image.altText: A close up shot of a woman with blonde hair mid speech.

props.synopsis: The federal government claims it is "serious" about going to the polls over its unsupported housing bill, which it will reintroduce to parliament, setting up a double dissolution election trigger.

title.children: 'Serious proposition': Government moves to reintroduce failed housing bill, reviving threat of double dissolution election

image.altText: A man is led out of a house in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Australian Federal Police allege the creator of Ghost app, used by criminals for communications had amassed millions in cryptocurrency.

title.children: Alleged Ghost app creator had millions in crypto, says AFP

image.altText: Richmond Tigers president John O'Rourke holding a media conference, speaking at the lecture, wearing a suit

props.synopsis: Richmond's president has taken a swipe at a departing quartet of premiership stars as megastar Dustin Martin shuts down speculation of coming out of retirement.

title.children: Richmond president takes swipe at leaving players, Martin says he will stay retired

image.altText: A composite image of two men talking

props.synopsis: Vice-presidential debates are usually low-stakes affairs. But in a US election of twists and turns, this one took on a greater significance. These were the key moments.

title.children: A deeply unpopular JD Vance had a lot to lose during the VP debate. These were the big moments

image.altText: Sean 'Diddy' Combs

props.synopsis: An additional 120 people have come forward with sexual misconduct allegations against US rap mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs who is awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.

title.children: 120 more alleged victims of Sean 'Diddy' Combs come forward to accuse rapper of sex crimes

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: A US dock workers' strike reaching from New York to Texas is throwing global supply chains into disarray. And Australians' weekly shop will not be immune.

title.children: Why the weekly shop for many Australians could be impacted by a US dock worker strike

image.altText: A man with a short tight haircut and military uniform stands speaking.

props.synopsis: In candid remarks during last month's International Land Forces conference in Melbourne, visiting Brigadier General Frank J Lozano expressed confidence that a "coalition of the willing" could outpace Beijing's rising regional dominance.

title.children: Visiting US general warns 'there is a fight coming', as he stresses importance of Australian alliance

image.altText: A man holds a bunch of bridles.

props.synopsis: An independent stewards panel charges leading Tasmanian harness trainer Ben Yole, his brother and two harness drivers under the Australian Harness Racing Rules.

title.children: Long-awaited racing stewards report charges leading horse trainer Ben Yole and others

image.altText: a young noni hazlehurst reading a play school book on the set of the children's show

props.synopsis: Australian acting legend Noni Hazlehurst has had a varied and storied career. In an extract from her new memoir, Dropping the Mask, she reflects on how Play School shaped her into the person she is today.

title.children: Noni Hazlehurst has been on our stages, screens and radios since the 70s. But she's most proud of Play School

image.altText: A rally for Gaza and Lebanon in Sydney

props.synopsis: Organisers says pro-Palestinian events will go ahead in Sydney this weekend even if they are prohibited by the NSW Supreme Court as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese backs NSW Police's attempts to prevent them from happening.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian events will go ahead in Sydney even if prohibited by court, organisers say

image.altText: Close up of Julian Assange with him holding up a fist.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange is back on European soil. When last here, he was behind bars.

title.children: 'Isolation has taken its toll': Julian Assange in his first public appearance since his release from a UK prison

image.altText: Alisa Camplin holds a gold medal

props.synopsis: Aerial skiing great Alisa Camplin-Warner will be chef de mission for the Australian team at the 2026 Winter Olympics.

title.children: Aerials legend Alisa Camplin-Warner to lead Australia's winter Olympics charge

image.altText: An apartment building.

props.synopsis: As property prices continue to rise, real estate agents say they are seeing a large appetite for smaller, cheaper properties in Sydney.

title.children: For the average income earner, Sydney's west is the last remaining option to buy a home

image.altText: Olaf the albino wallaby joey

props.synopsis: Zookeepers have discovered a joey, born to red-necked wallabies at Symbio Wildlife Park, is an albino. Only one in 100,000 wallabies exhibit the rare genetic condition.

title.children: It took zookeepers months to discover Olaf was a rare albino wallaby

image.altText: Sold

props.synopsis: With negative gearing and capital gains tax back on the national agenda, experts say such reforms would be unlikely to lead to a major fall in property prices. But some investors say they could be forced to sell if there are changes to property tax breaks and that could force rents higher.

title.children: 'It's going to be very uncertain for us': Investors weigh in on negative gearing debate

image.altText: Fagan and cup

props.synopsis: Lions coach Chris Fagan has been spotted doing 'the most Brisbane thing ever' after taking the AFL premiership cup out during his morning walk for a coffee.

title.children: 'He had it wrapped in a towel': Lions coach Fagan spotted taking AFL cup for a walk in suburban Brisbane

image.altText: Queensland Ambulance Service emblem on the shoulder of an officer on a job.

props.synopsis: Authorities have confirmed that one of two workers involved in an incident at Oaky Creek Coal Mine in central Queensland has died.

title.children: Worker dies after incident at Queensland coal mine

image.altText: Tiny possum nestled within brown blanket

props.synopsis: A Victorian emblem — the lowland Leadbeater's possum — is dangerously close to extinction, with only a few dozen left in the wild in a small forest patch in the Yarra Ranges.

title.children: How 'future-proofing' Victoria's forests could help save the state's iconic emblem
